meanings.sent1: After dinner, I had to reboil the water for my tea.
meanings.sent2: If you leave the soup on the stove too long, you may need to reboil it.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally fell asleep while waiting for the water to reboil.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the room seemed to reboil as the game reached its climax.
meanings.sent5: The frustration of the situation made her emotions reboil.

meanings.definition: To heat liquid until it boils again.
meanings.sent1: To make sure the pasta is cooked properly, you may need to reboil the water.
meanings.sent2: If the tea gets cold, you can quickly reboil it in the microwave.
meanings.sent3: She had to reboil the milk three times before it was hot enough for her coffee.
meanings.sent4: The argument between the siblings seemed to reboil every time they discussed it.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room seemed to reboil as they waited for the results.
